description:
Phyllostomus discolor, also known as the pale spear-nosed bat, is a species of bat belonging to the family Phyllostomidae. It is a medium-sized bat found in Central and South America, ranging from Mexico to Brazil.

The Phyllostomus discolor has a distinctive appearance, with a spear-shaped nose leaf and large, rounded ears. Its fur is generally a greyish-brown color, with a paler underside. The wings are relatively large and broad, allowing for efficient flight. 

These bats are primarily insectivorous, feeding on a variety of insects such as moths, beetles, and flies. They use their echolocation abilities to locate and capture their prey in flight. Phyllostomus discolor is known to roost in caves, abandoned buildings, and tree hollows, often forming large colonies.

The species is considered of Least Concern by the IUCN, as it has a wide distribution and appears to be relatively common throughout its range. However, it may face some threats from habitat loss and disturbance of its roosting sites.
